{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63111].
  {panel}

We are making use of the incoming mail handler a lot.

And there are a lot of emails that can not be handled because of an invalid sender or subject values.

Those invalid messages pile up and JIRA retries to import them on every run.

After a couple of days, we reach a state where JIRA can't process any mail.

It would be nice to have a config option to delete every invalid mail.
fields.summary: Add option to delete incoming mails that can not be handled

h3. Problem Definition

Now it's unable to know what and when a integrated development tool hooks workflow trigger on JIRA.
 It makes hard to know the cause why triggers don't work as expected – it is sometimes because of known bug such as JSW-14663 and other times configuration failure.
h3. Suggested Solution

To have a page which shows workflow triggers' history.
fields.summary: A page to refer workflow triggers' history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63106].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if the user that is tied to a token in {{oauthsptoken}} does not exist in {{cwd_user}} table - this makes one of the Scheduler job; *CompatibilityPluginScheduler.JobId.Service Provider Session Remover* fails with the following error:
{noformat}2016-07-27 09:02:38,879 Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'CompatibilityPluginScheduler.JobId.Service Provider Session Remover' failed
com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.InvalidTokenException: Token 'DeEdwSKAgEMamU39X50H4uMX7yx6Uwqg' is an access token, but has no user associated with it
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.createTokenFromGV(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:322)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokens(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:250)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:238)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.CachingServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(CachingServiceProviderTokenStore.java:106)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	... 2 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:317)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:207)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1194.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.DelegatingTokenStoreImpl.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(DelegatingTokenStoreImpl.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.ExpiredSessionRemover.execute(ExpiredSessionRemover.java:25)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.compat.clustered.ClusteredJobRunner.runJob(ClusteredJobRunner.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:401)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:396)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:349)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:255)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
That means the table {{oauthsptoken}} will keep growing in size because the job that suppose to purge the data in that table is being triggered and fails due to 1 or more invalid ACCESS token(s). Due to this, the records in the table is kept without any purging and also it creates some invalid REQUEST tokens in the table, for example:
{noformat}
| 490159 | 2016-08-31 15:54:04 | 2diaN9RRfbp9QslzjyjJWzh5NuNj4nIr | TVYUpHnFDdUvPeHVR0JMTkCC7QC9n3Ys | REQUEST    | Confluence:xxxxxxxxx | NULL     |       600000 | NONE       | http://<baseURL>/confluence/plugins/servlet/gadgets/oauth-callback | NULL       | V_1_0_A   | NULL                             | NULL                  | NULL                      | NULL                 |
| 490158 | 2016-08-31 15:53:48 | 8oCvjMa5Vk7LceN3FWxSYvZNf0u7zmpA | SHJbAmOWMmbXOGu1ywBNpLLQ4UkA4V9C | REQUEST    | Confluence:xxxxxxxxx | NULL     |       600000 | NONE       | http://<baseURL>/confluence/plugins/servlet/gadgets/oauth-callback | NULL       | V_1_0_A   | NULL                             | NULL                  | NULL                      | NULL                 |
| 490157 | 2016-08-31 15:53:32 | eHdogIdSLpq6CtTsCb1xt5LPDc7eIElW | cc3dbtHiauvlN5tJxP19pjEIb68pNm94 | REQUEST    | Confluence:xxxxxxxxx | NULL     |       600000 | NONE       | http://<baseURL>/confluence/plugins/servlet/gadgets/oauth-callback | NULL       | V_1_0_A   | NULL                             | NULL                  | NULL                      | NULL                 |
| 490156 | 2016-08-31 15:53:16 | w4NKljZKmKekJezqwj89Aao0neVf1yNl | 9suIWzuSM9B4oTUCW7LLZs3fdEmEs9Eh | REQUEST    | Confluence:xxxxxxxxx | NULL     |       600000 | NONE       | http://<baseURL>/confluence/plugins/servlet/gadgets/oauth-callback | NULL       | V_1_0_A   | NULL                             | NULL                  | NULL                      | NULL                 |
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove those tokens from {{oauthsptoken}} table if the user does not exist in {{cwd_user}} table - why do we need to keep tokens for a user that does not exist in JIRA anymore?
h3. Workaround

(!) Always take a DB backup before you are removing any data from any DB table.
h2. Option 1
 # Find the invalid tokens by running the following SQL and remove them from {{oauthsptoken}} table.:
{noformat}select * from oauthsptoken where token_type = 'ACCESS' and username not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user);
{noformat}
This SQL is not perfect - you will need to cross check those users from the result in {{app_user}} table to make sure those users got renamed before.
 # As an alternative, this SQL will be more accurate but this is not tested:
{noformat}select * from oauthsptoken where token_type = 'ACCESS' and username not in (select user_key from app_user)
{noformat}

h2. Option 2
 # Wait for the job to be triggered and remove the token that the job is complaining about.
 # From the error above, we can see that token {{DeEdwSKAgEMamU39X50H4uMX7yx6Uwqg}} is the one that is failing. Remove the token from the {{oauthsptoken}} table by using this SQL:
{noformat}delete from oauthsptoken where token='DeEdwSKAgEMamU39X50H4uMX7yx6Uwqg';
{noformat}
(i) Replace the token with the error that you are getting.
# Beside the log file, you will be able to check the error at {{Administration > System > Scheduler details}} page, find for {{CompatibilityPluginScheduler.JobRunnerKey.Service Provider Session Remover}}, click on _Show more_. The error message is this page will give you the token that you will need to remove.
# This job is scheduled to run in 8 hours interval, which means if you have few invalid token, then you will need to wait for the _Next run_ - to get the next token that you will need to remove to DB.
fields.summary: Service Provider Session Remover should remove token if the user does not exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63104].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

User trying to build JQL Queries within their instances cannot click on the Autocomplete Suggestion while using Google Chrome.

When the suggestion is clicked, the autocomplete closes and does not complete the query

h3. Environment
* Cloud with Chrome Version 54.0.2840.87 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Chrome, navigate to Issues > Search for Issues
# Switch to "Advanced"
# Begin to type in "Project"
# When the Autocomplete Suggestion, try to click on Project in the Dropdown

h3. Expected Results
The Query is filled in

h3. Actual Results
The Autocomplete Suggestion closes and leaves an incomplete query
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Use an alternative browser like Firefox or Safari
_Tested with Firefox 49.0.2 and Safari Version 10.0.1 (12602.2.14.0.7)_

If using Chrome, arrow down and press Tab or Enter to confirm the selection
fields.summary: Unable to Click on JQL Suggestion Using Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63103].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Jira administrators sometimes need to know the time tickets spent on specific statuses for reporting or auditing purposes. For example, this may be used for checking how long a specific tickets remained in backlog until it was worked on.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add to tickets information about the time spent in each status the tickets has already been in. This could be another tab next to history, for example, that lists all the status the ticket has been to and the amount of time it spent on each. This functionality is available already in some apps.
fields.summary: Way to collect exact time a issue spend in a workflow - JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63101].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
With the CSV exporter in JIRA 7.2.x, the export of issue data does at least include a reference to attachments on that issue.  However it currently does this only with an explicit site URL path (e.g.  {{08/Nov/16 11:58 AM;admin;mario.jpg;http://localhost:8724/secure/attachment/10015/mario.jpg}}).   The problem with this comes when you want to import that CSV data back into JIRA.  

*Current Behavior:*
The CSV import process can import attachments in two ways per [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-data-from-csv-802592885.html]

# If you use a relative reference for an attachments such as file://csvimport/mario.jpg then you can actually place those files in the <[jira-home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-home-directory-189891162.html]>/import/attachment/ path.  If those files exist in that location at the time of the CSV import, then those files are processed and added to the <[jira-home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-home-directory-189891162.html]>/data/attachments folder correctly
# Alternatively, if you import the CSV with the site explicit site URL (which is the current behavior of the CSV exporter in JIRA 7.2), then these files have to exist in that site URL in order to be usable by JIRA.  This typically is not a problem on the host instance where these files were first attached, but if you have an external JIRA instance where the CSV import is being performed, then in this JIRA instance those files do not exist yet.  Then it becomes a very tedious task to figure out the correct folder hierarchy and format where these files should exist so that you can import these in a CSV import.  (This seems to be complicated further by JIRA 7.2.x current behavior to rename these flat files into a 5 digit number with no file extension)  <[jira-home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-home-directory-189891162.html]>/data/attachments/PROJECT_KEY/10000/ISSUE_KEY/10015

*Desired Behavior:*
This is where it would be helpful if when exporting the CSV file, rather than providing an http link to the attachment, instead provide a relative path that would correspond to how those attachments are actually stored in the <[jira-home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-home-directory-189891162.html]>/data/attachment/ folder.

Instead of:
{{08/Nov/16 11:58 AM;admin;mario.jpg;http://localhost:8724/secure/attachment/10015/mario.jpg}}

This would be exported as
{{08/Nov/16 11:58 AM;admin;mario.jpg;/attachment/PROJECT_KEY/10000/ISSUE_KEY/10015}}

This would make it much easier to then import this attachment data to a new instance of JIRA.  Since the system is currently storing that data in this format, it would be much easier for someone to simply copy the files as they exist in the current directory over to the /import/ folder in order to import these in a method that another JIRA instance will understand.
fields.summary: JIRA CSV Export should provide more explicit path for attachment locations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63100].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever the _Resolution field_ is updated, the _Resolution Date_ is updated accordingly. This will mess up the statistics or reports especially for resolved cases.

There are some situations where the Resolution value is set but the request is not closed yet, and when the request is closed, the Resolution value is updated. The Resolution Date will be updated twice but the first Resolution Date is the real date for a request to be 'resolved'. However, it's not possible to retain the first Resolution Date.

h3. Suggestion
A way to update the Resolution field without affecting the Resolution Date
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to change the Resolution value without updating the Resolution Date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63093].
  {panel}

Hello

We are having problems with Jira default email sending mechanism. Everything works fine until the weekend comes. Then usually something happens (we tried but we could not find any cause) and Jira stops sending emails. Mail queue is getting larger and larger and the only solution we have found is to manually flush the mail queue and restart Jira application. Then everything works fine again until one of the next weekends.

We encounter this problem only on weekends but it is not happening on every weekend.. We tried to look for any sugestions in JIRA logs, serwer logs, exchange logs and nothing is there – it seemed as if simply Jira had stopped sending email and that’s it.

I will be very grateful for an answer if there is a known bug perhaps? Maybe you could provide us with some information regarding how to diagnose this problem?

We are using Jira Core 7.1.4 and Software 7.1.10 (we used 7.1.4 before with the same problem, upgrade did not help)

Regards
fields.summary: JIRA stops sending notification emails on weekends

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63082].
  {panel}

h3. Description

If it is necessary to have multiple site-admins' in a JIRA instance, *Site-Admin* should be able to control who has the 'Login as User' ability and when it is used a notification could be sent to a group of users.

h3. Example

Admin user A and admin user B, user A has the ability to 'login as user' they are both in the same *site-admin* group and if admin user A uses this ability an email should be sent to all users inside *site-admin* group.

E.g:

An example of the message to all users in *site-admin* or *administrators* group. "User A has impersonated User C using the 'log in as user' feature."

h3. Suggestion

Implement a configuration where the 'log in as user' ability could be optional, for users inside *site-admin* and when used trigger an email to all users in *site-admin* group.
fields.summary: Limit login as user ability
To list all the favorite filters when the user view issues under project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63080].
  {panel}

Need:

End user might want to see what information is needed to make a transition, without actually making the transition.

Current Situation:

As an end user, it is not possible to see if there is a transition screen for a given issue transition. The only way to see it is to click the transition button and if there is not a transition screen bound to it, the transition instantly takes place.

Proposed Solution:

The transition button should display a visual clue whether there is a transition screen or not. It could be as simple as adding "..." to the transition name.

Ex: The button should display "Start Progress" if there is not a transition screen afterwards and "Start Progress..." if there is a transition screen afterwards.
fields.summary: Transition buttons should hint about the presence of a transition screen

With a single line text field being changed, in JIRA 6.4 the answer is about 5000 times for a large JIRA.

After that the Issue History tab will not load any more. Probably because all the history is displayed on a single page instead of being paged and showing 50 at a time as the Work Log tab does.

Note that the rest of the issue displays fine, and it is just the Issue History and All tabs that do not.

Some fuuther discussion about this appears at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/43741145/how-many-times-can-i-edit-a-jira-issue
fields.summary: How many times can I edit a JIRA issue?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63073].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary *

When updating JIRA issue fields using the IssueService, the change-history includes an erroneous update of the Parent Link field

_*For example, Using the JIRA IssueService interface to successfully update issue Fix-Version*_
h3. *Expected Result*

**The Fix-Version field is updated, and the change history shows the update of the fix version field. 
h3. *Actual Result*

The change-history shows the expected field update, eg an update of the Fix-Version field, plus an update of Parent Link, even though the Parent Link field value remains unchanged. 
h3. *Workaround*:

explicitly set retainExistingValues/ValidatePresentFields via setRetainExistingValuesWhenParameterNotProvided() eg,
{code:java}// Retain existing values and only validate present fields. issueInputParameters.setRetainExistingValuesWhenParameterNotProvided( true, true ){code}
fields.summary: When updating jira issue fields using the IssueService, the change-history includes an erroneous update of the Parent Link field
3la tarek issue

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for additional platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here.|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63066]

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Restoring data into Oracle from Atlassian Cloud instances or other database systems can fail with "ORA-01461: can bind a LONG value only for insert into a LONG column" errors due to the fact that in JIRA's fieldtype-oracle10g.xml, "very-long" is defined as a VARCHAR(4000). Any entity field that is defined as such in the entitymodel.xml can potentially contain large enough data in other database systems resulting in this problem when restoring into Oracle.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the definition for very-long in fieldtype-oracle10g.xml to something more compatible with content from other database systems.
 
h3. Workaround 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ora-01461-can-bind-a-long-value-only-for-insert-into-a-long-column-error-due-to-oracle-database-definition-191500952.html
fields.summary: ORA-01461 when restoring data into Oracle

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63065].
  {panel}

Hi,

This ticket was created by [~azhdanov] in the Ecosystem Developer Service Desk: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/projects/DEVHELP/queues/custom/104/DEVHELP-72]

He points out that some error messages are spamming the catalina log file, which is hindersome for the end-users.

As this a suggestion for improvement I reposted it here.

Cheers,

Peter
fields.summary: To many JSONObject["html"] not found in catalina log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63062].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When exporting JIRA issues to Excel, it exports files in XLS files. The same occurs for exports to Word, which generates files in DOC format. These files have multiple disadvantages when compared to the new file types introduced by Microsoft in 2007 (DOCX, XLSX and PPTX). That's because those new file formats are XML-based, which allows for much better compression, resulting in considerably smaller files.

Also, Excel's new file format (XLSX) adds an extra layer of security by blocking the usage of Macros, which requires the file to be saved as XLSM. XLS files allows for any Macro to be included and is being blocked by multiple System Administrators, especially in companies with higher standards for security.

h3. Example
Exporting around 4900 issues to Excel from JIRA currently generates a file with an approximate size of 7.5 MB. If we convert that file to XLSX once it has been opened in Excel 2007 or later, the file size drops to less than 10% of the original file's size.

h3. Workaround
The [Better Excel Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.midori.jira.plugin.betterexcel], developed by Midori, adds additional features for exporting issues to Excel in JIRA, including the ability to export directly to XLSX.

(i) _Please note third-party add-ons, such as "Better Excel Plugin", *are not* supported by Atlassian. Therefore, support and maintenance is purely responsibility of the add-on's vendor._
fields.summary: JIRA Exports files in old format / standards resulting in large file sizes

h3. Summary
When creating a new Project in JIRA, warnings about the use of a deprecated token are logged. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and setup JIRA
# Create a Project

h3. Expected Results
Project is created with no Warnings captured in {{atlassian-jira.log}}

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the *atlassian-jira.log* file:
{noformat}2016-11-03 15:24:04,438 http-nio-8080-exec-13 WARN rstadler 924x103x1 1r7q1fr 192.168.19.1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.p.r.c.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter] Use of the 'nocheck' value for X-Atlassian-Token has been deprecated since rest 3.0.0. Please use a value of 'no-check' instead.
2016-11-03 15:24:04,446 http-nio-8080-exec-13 WARN rstadler 924x103x1 1r7q1fr 192.168.19.1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.p.r.c.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter] Use of the 'nocheck' value for X-Atlassian-Token has been deprecated since rest 3.0.0. Please use a value of 'no-check' instead.{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
You can suppress the output for *{{com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter}}* to keep the messages from being logged if you don't want to see these in logs, but this risks suppressing something you would want to capture normally.
fields.summary: Warnings in log about deprecated XSRF token when creating new project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63054].
  {panel}

here is the use case:  
 Pavel just entered a comment on a work item. When I looked at it, I realized that comment should become a new work item.  

As is functionality:  I have to go hit the Create button, and do the work to create it as a subtask, copy and paste other details for both of the features, forcing me to have two browser windows open concurrently to make sure I line everything up correctly between the parent and child ticket.

Desired to Be behavior: 

I would click a button somewhere within Jira, ideally next to the comment.  it would start a Create issue to create a new work item on the same project, with default making it a subtask of the existing task.  The comment would populate the description field.  I could then edit the new ticket as I would during the Create issue functionality and save it.

Similarly, within a story or task, it would be great to have a button to press to create a child of that item with a bunch of the things defaulted.
fields.summary: Jira feature request - convert comment into new issue on board

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63053].
  {panel}

As a developer I want to be able to:
 * validate dependent field values(and change if necessary) with no additional transitions with screens in the workflow, even sytem fields etc
 * make validation work on any required level of API(IssueService, IssueManager) to avoid unconsistencies in critical data

For example I want to implement group assign practice. I want to be sure that assignee is always is a member of group selected or unassigned. I want it to be available with inline edit.

If I change group - assignee should be set to Unassigned - there's no API to make such things

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63039].
  {panel}

In a Dashboard configuration, one can include a "Filter Results" gadget which generates a table of JIRA issues defined by a filter. When normally viewing a filter:
{quote}[https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?filter=]<id>
{quote}
Selecting an issue inside the filter will bring up the issue with a filter navigation box in the top-right (up/down/back). This allows a user to view/adjust the issue being viewed and provides a way to go to the "next" issue without having to go back to a table. This is achieved by appending the {{filter}} key to the URL request:
{quote}[https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/]<issue>?filter=<id>
{quote}
When using the "Filter Results" gadget (mentioned above), selecting an issue link does not include the {{filter}} key in the request.
----
Can this gadget be updated to either:
 # Always append the {{filter}} key for any issue being browsed to; or,
 # Provide a configuration option for the gadget which allows the capability mentioned in the first point.

A current workaround to select the "total issue count" in the footer of the gadget; but I'm under the assumption that this only shows if the gadget content has more issues then the maximum issue limit for said gadget.
fields.summary: support passing filter in dashboard's filter results gadget

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When exporting issues as CSV, only *outward links* are available in the CSV file. 
 !links.png|thumbnail! 

If an issue has an *inward link* to another issue and the other issue has not been exported, that will not appear in the CSV file, which could possibly cause confusions for the customers. 

Along with causing confusion; the current functionality does not allow "Related issues fields" from being migrated from one project to another.  


h3. Suggested Solution 
Include an "Related issues fields" column in the CSV files.
fields.summary: CSV Export should include "all related issues fields"

h3. Summary

Project "View Issues" for priority has duplicate sorting causing error.

\{noformat}

project = 11400 AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY priority DESC, priority DESC, key ASC

\{noformat}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to project summary
 # Switch the view to *Statistics* if necessary
 # Under *Unresolved: By Priority* section, click on *View Issues*
 # JIRA will throw error {{The sort field 'priority' is referenced multiple times in the JQL sort}}

h3. Current result

JIRA failed to provide a result for the search query.
h3. Expected result

JIRA returns search result with the specified sorting.
h3. Workaround

 Edit the JQL manually by removing the duplicate sorting {{priority DESC,}} and rerun the search.
fields.summary: Project "View Issues" for priority has duplicate sorting causing error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63033].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Project version is showing spinning wheel when user doesn't have Browse Project permission.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to {{https://<instance URL>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project key>/administer-versions}} with a user who doesn't have *Browse Project* permission.

h3. Actual Result

It shows below error message with spinning wheel.
{noformat}
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{noformat}

h3. Expected Result

If *Browse Project* permission is needed to access it, JIRA should display proper error message. Or else, project version page should be displayed without any error.

h3. Notes

Getting _404 Not Found_ error message in network console as it can't find the project key.
{noformat}
https://<instance URL>/rest/projects/1.0/project/undefined/release/allversions?_=1478073320259
{noformat}

* We noticed that the same behavior is reproduced on other screens such as: Browse Projects 
 when selecting it (projects/PRJ)

h3. Workaround

# Grant the user with *Browse Project* permission or 
# Manually change the URL to {{https://<instance URL>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project key>/versions}}
fields.summary: Project version is showing spinning wheel when user doesn't have Browse Project permission

  {panel}

h2. Summary
CSV Exporter removed the limit of 1000 issues per export.
So users can export a huge number of records.
This will affects JIRA Server performance when some users export a huge data at same time.
Admin would like to set the limit number of exporting data for preventing the performance issue.


h2. Suggestion
Allow Admin user can set the limit number of exporting records for CSV Exporter.
or CSV Exporter uses jira.search.views.default.max, jira.search.views.max.limit parameters.
fields.summary: Provide a limit number of exporting records for CSV Exporter in JIRA 7.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63023].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA PDF preview doesn't show text entries if user used Adobe Acrobat Reader to edit the PDF form.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Use any PDF form
# Fill in some information in the PDF using Adobe Acrobat Reader
# Attach the PDF to JIRA issue
# Preview it in the issue - don't download it

h3. Current result
The text entries in the PDF file won't be rendered by JIRA, showing blank field.

h3. Expected result
JIRA renders the text entries in preview mode.

h3. Workaround
Edit the PDF form in other PDF reader e.g. Foxit Reader.
fields.summary: JIRA PDF preview doesn't show text entries if user used Adobe Acrobat Reader to edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63022].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
While viewing a JIRA Issue, the Issue Operation bar would not be sticky/frozen/locked when the user scrolls down the page if the Project Sidebar is present. 
Eg: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1?filter=-1

However, without the Sidebar, the Issue Operation bar does not disappear when the user scrolls down the page
Eg: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1

Therefore if you have an issue with for example 100 comments, then the user will have to scroll all the way up to click on any of the issue operation buttons. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the Issue Operation bar sticky in all cases. 

h3. Workaround
Append a string {{?jql=}} to the URL after the issue key. However, this only works for logged in users.
* For example, {{https://localhost:8080/browse/<issueKey>?jql=}}
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the operation bar to always be sticky/visible when I scroll down the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63018].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As of September 7th 2016, Turkey has decided to no longer follow the practice of having DST. As a result, their timezone has been changed from GMT+2 to GMT+3.

At the current stage of writing, JIRA's bundled JRE does not contain the data that reflects this change, hence causing Istanbul's timezone to be listed as GMT+2 instead of GMT+3.
h3. Workaround

* Download the latest joda-time release here: https://github.com/JodaOrg/joda-time/releases
* Replace the existing joda-time-*.jar file in:
**  $jira_install/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib
* Restart JIRA Afterwards.
fields.summary: The current JRE of JIRA does not reflect Istanbul's time zone change.

h3. Problem Definition

Based on the information located on this bug : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30620

Specifically:  Once a user has created an issue in a project in the current session, JIRA retains the issue type from the previous issue any time the user creates a new issue in the same project. This is intended to make it easier for users to quickly create issues, such as when a software developer is creating a number of stories for a sprint or a QA engineer is filing bugs.

Requesting that this behavior has a toggle so that we can

h3. Suggested Solution

Requesting that this behavior has a toggle so that we can choose the behavior of the default issue type to always use the default specified and not retain the last used.

(Optional)

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Entries in the activity stream with same time stamp may not show up in the correct order as it had occurred

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# To get an occurance of same timestamp, you will have to use an plugin like [JIRA Automation Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin/server/overview]
# Create a simple automation to add a comment on issue creation
# Create an issue and go to the created issues activity tab

h3. Expected Results
The activity tab always shows the latest update on top. Therefore it is expected that the on top of the activity stream tab of the issue, you should see the comment and the last should be issues created as it is the fist task:
!correct.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes this is logged correctly, however at times it appears the other way around:
!incorrect.png|thumbnail!
Where the comment is logged as added first in activity stream.  

h3. Notes
* From the database from the jiraissue and jiraaction table, we see that it has the exact time stamp to the millisecond, therefore it seems that JIRA isn't able to determine which is the first event. 
* perhaps for this case, we can make JIRA always have create issue the first item in the activity stream to avoid this incorrectness in the future.
fields.summary: Entries in the activity stream with same time stamp may not show up in the correct order as it had occurred

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62964].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

I'd like to preface this with saying that the current session timeout behavior is not in question here; this is a request for an additional feature that will terminate a user's session.

We're looking to fulfill a security requirement for our organization that will kick a user out of there current session and redirect them to a log in page automatically, much like a banking website.

Currently a session timeout results in the user seeing a cached page and once they click on something they are directed to provide their credentials. What we'd like to happen (again as an additional feature, not a change to the core functionality of a session timeout) is an automatic redirect to a log in screen.

The end goal is to not leave potentially sensitive information visible to unauthorized users.

Preferably, enabling this setting in crowd would apply this behavior to all products involved, e.g., Jira, Confluence, etc.. That said enabling this setting on individual components is acceptable as well.

The support ticket that this is in reference to is CWDSUP-12774
fields.summary: Redirect to login after session timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62960].
  {panel}

I love that JIRA can send email for _every_ action on a ticket, including mine, so that I can look at my email thread and see a full record of everything that happened. Also, that searching in my email lets me search for my own words and findings as well, and I don't have to go somewhere else to search for them (unlike what many services like, say, Github do with their notifications: not sending me mine, which I hate). I love this!

But:

It does get annoying sometimes to do a bunch of actions in JIRA and immediately get many emails in my inbox. So I'd like emails for actions triggered by me to be treated specially somehow, so that I can filter them in Gmail (e.g. automatically mark them as read).

Ideas for "treated specially somehow" may be: they could contain a particular string, which I could filter on. Another cool idea is what Github has started doing recently: if you're getting a notification because you were mentioned, the email you get is cc-ed to {{Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>}}. If you're getting a notification because you were the author, the email you get has a cc to {{Author <author@noreply.github.com>}}. 

May it be possible for JIRA to do something similar, e.g. the email's "from" address could be "<UserName>-JIRA <jira@zenefits.com>" with the text in the from changing based on whose action triggered the email? (Right now, the from header is always: "Notifications (JIRA) <jira@zenefits.com>".)
fields.summary: Some way to tag JIRA emails triggered by my own actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62952].
  {panel}

I recently set up email notifications on our local JIRA server installation, afterwards I was looking through the online documentation on where jira stores the settings for the various email servers you can configure (again, information like this would be really helpful, but is often lacking)

After some quick searches through the servers file system revealed that none of the settings I made could be found anywhere in the filesystem i started looking through database for the jira installation, surely enough, there is a table named "mailservers".

The column "mailpassword" holds the the password for each server as plain text, unsalted and unhashed.

Could we please have proper password storage for the email server configuration?
fields.summary: Do not store password for email servers as plain text in jira app db

h3. Summary

When you attempt to release a version in JIRA with your language set to French, the date box will autocorrect the month with a dot (ex : oct.), but the validation of the box needs the month without a dot (ex : oct). This makes it impossible to release a version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set profile or system language to French
 # Attempt to select a Start Date or End Date when creating a version in a project

h3. Expected Results

The format should follow the date picker format set in Advanced Configuration.
h3. Actual Results

Even when selecting the date from the calendar popup, the month will always have a "." at the end, which the system will not accept. Attempting to change it does not work, as when you click out of the box, the "." reappears.
h3. Workaround

Change the Date format parameters (or contact Atlassian Support to do this for Cloud customers) to a format that only uses numerals for months, such as to d/MM/yy

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/__date+and+time+formats]
h3. Workaround.2

Change the system language to English;

Perform the change in the version date;

Change back de language to French.
fields.summary: When language is set to French, date picker bug

h3. Summary

When adding an issue link from ticket A to ticket B and vice-versa, both links show in two issues, even though they are both exactly the same.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link issue A with issue B
# Link issue B with issue A

h3. Expected Results

Only one link would show in both issues as the links are exactly the same

h3. Actual Results

Both of the links show in the two tickets:

 !Pasted_Image_20_10_16_17_55.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Consolidate issue links on JIRA

h3. Current Behaviour

Upon enabling Public Signup in JIRA, all users created that way are automatically assigned to the "Default" group on {{Administration > Applications > Application Access}}.

h3. Expected Behaviour

It would be great if administrators could configure which group the users that signed up through public sign up belong to.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to choose default groups for public sign up

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62917].
  {panel}

At this moment, when customer ran an import to JIRA Cloud, there are no warning message about user removal. 

Customer might not aware that this move will affects the other application that shared the same user management. Eg: Confluence Cloud

Confluence Cloud application will be impacted during JIRA Cloud import if they are in the same instance.

Suggesting to create a text warning message to inform customer with Confluence Cloud, that this operation (JIRA Import) will affects Confluence Cloud and user will not be able to use the application until the import is completed.
fields.summary: Warn Users during JIRA Cloud Import that Users will be removed

2. The layout (attached screenshot) is a bit messed up in Chrome (stable): "Get the app" button, and warning message hidden under link
3. The "Show more" link doesn't do anything at all
4. I'm not in the US. Perhaps try some geolocation? :)

Hi,

I am struggling to convince our developers to stick to Jira and not move over to Trello. But I'm having a hard time given that the Boards in Jira seems to not care much about the overall look'n'feel of the board. 

An example here is that is prints a lot of NONE labels for missing field data instead of nothing (which would be the correct approach). See attachment.

The overall opinion here at our company is that there is too much going on in the Jira interface. Removing these "NONE" labels all over in the boards would be a start.
fields.summary: Not show NONE for missing field data in kanban/scrum boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62907].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
At the moment, while using JIRA and executing a series of transitions at a time, our mail boxes are spammed by mail notifications.

An example:
{format}Someone created a ticket for me.
The ticket was then assigned to me.
The description was modified four times in the same minute.
So I received five e-mails in a span of five minutes to tell me I had to work on one ticket.
{format}

h3. Solution
If e-mails were delayed by 5 minutes and then regrouped. I would have to receive only one e-mail. We still want to receive all notifications, although grouped.

h3. Workaround
Disable notifications for the specific event on the notification scheme or change the generic event that will be fired on the workflow.
fields.summary: Group notifications on JIRA notification's scheme
